intro: Hedyotis shoolamudi, commonly known as the Indian bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. It produces small, white or yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive botanical appearance.
